TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed TransactionIsolationLevel extends System.Enum

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the TransactionIsolationLevel type.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServicesTransactionIsolationLevel#0](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.enterpriseservi_16_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServicesTransactionIsolationLevel#0](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.enterpriseservi_16_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServicesTransactionIsolationLevel#0](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.enterpriseservi_16_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.EnterpriseServices.TransactionIsolationLevel Any = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The isolation level for the component is obtained from the calling component's isolation level. If this is the root component, the isolation level used is Serializable.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.EnterpriseServices.TransactionIsolationLevel ReadCommitted = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Shared locks are held while the data is being read to avoid reading modified data, but the data can be changed before the end of the transaction, resulting in non-repeatable reads or phantom data.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.EnterpriseServices.TransactionIsolationLevel ReadUncommitted = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Shared locks are issued and no exclusive locks are honored.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.EnterpriseServices.TransactionIsolationLevel RepeatableRead = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Locks are placed on all data that is used in a query, preventing other users from updating the data. Prevents non-repeatable reads, but phantom rows are still possible.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.EnterpriseServices.TransactionIsolationLevel Serializable = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Prevents updating or inserting until the transaction is complete.
